content.description: Stand start the right side of the arete/bowl on the smaller boulder about 6-8 feet away from the huge boulder.
content.location: After passing the first sizable block on the left side of the trail, (Trailside Boulder 1) walk 3-4 minutes and then break right into the woods and head towards the pond to find this problem.

content.description: Sit start with a good right hand crimp, a tiny left divot, and good feet. Move straight up. Easier if you reach left to the scooped arête.
content.location: This is about 3-4 feet right of the problem Spoon Fed.

content.description: Jump start as for Feeding Time, but instead of moving right up the sloping ramp, make a big move straight up to a small crimp and then decent holds above. At the lip, move slightly left to find a good flake for the topout.
content.location: Use the same start as Feeding Time.

content.description: Stand start with a flat left hand and right hand pinching the arête. Move straight up, mantle, and top out.
content.location: This is on the smaller Twin Boulder. Start 5-6 feet left of a big, rounded out scoop/bowl.

content.description: Sit start with a great foot ledge, and move pretty much straight up.
content.location: This is the steep slab about 4 feet right of the problem On the Spectrum.

content.description: Jump start to the slopey rail about 10’ left of Code Breaker. Move right, and finish the same as Code Breaker. It’s the obvious line going up and right.
content.location: This is about 8–10’ left of Code Breaker. Find the obvious slopey rail on the big twin that you can jump to.

content.description: Stand start the left side of the bowl with a good left crimp and your right hand on the scoop created by the bowl. Move up to a tiny left crimp, then pop again to a better round dot, and top out.
content.location: After passing the first sizable block on the left, (Trailside Boulder 1), walk 3-4 minutes and cut right into the woods and head towards the pond to find the boulders and this problem.

content.description: This climbs the steep slab on little crimps starting at two fairly obvious crimps about nipple high. Step up on shitty feet, and go for something up high. The crux is pretty bouldery and beta intensive.
content.protection: A pad. It has a good landing.
content.location: This is on the slabby face of the smaller boulder.  Look for the cleaned of section of rock right of the tree.

content.description: Sit start on the right arete on the backside of the boulder with a thin left undercling and a right hand crimpy sidepull. Power up.
content.location: Cut right into the woods about 3-4 minutes after passing the first sizable boulder (Trailside Boulder 1), and head towards the pond.

content.description: These are two blocks right next to each other. One is a 20 footer and the other is about 14 feet.
